GCM modelling of the climate evolution of the last Millennium
EU's Millennium Project, we simulate the climate evolution from year
800 to present using a variant of HadCM3 climate GCM model. By comparing
an ensemble of simulations in the pre-industrial period with observations,
we can reduce the uncertainties of the model itself and better estimate
the magnitude of the natural variability. We will then run the
successful models to project the climate changes into the future.
The origin of differing sensitivities within ensemble simulations of climate change

This figure shows the pattern of variability associated with a change in the entrainment coefficient in zonally averaged relative humidity profiles taken from the HADAM3 Climate Model. The peaks seen in the Northern Hemisphere Tropics and Antarctic are associated with a change in the water vapour feedback that can be observed in these regions when the models are subjected to greenhouse gas forcing.
